tool.name: Seurat Plot dimension reduction
tool.description: graphs the output of a dimensional reduction technique (PCA by default). Cells are colored by their identity class.
tool.command: seurat-dim-plot.R @INPUT_OBJECT@ #if $reduction_use --reduction-use '$reduction_use' #end if #if $dim_1 --dim-1 $dim_1 #end if #if $dim_2 --dim-2 $dim_2 #end if #if $cells_use --cells-use $cells_use #end if #if $pt_size --pt-size $pt_size #end if #if $label_size --label-size $label_size #end if --do-label $do_label #if $group_by --group-by $group_by #end if #if $plot_title --plot-title '$plot_title' #end if --do-bare $do_bare #if $cols_use --cols-use '$cols_use' #end if #if $pt_shape --pt-shape '$pt_shape' #end if --coord-fixed $coord_fixed --no-axes $no_axes --dark-theme $dark_theme #if $plot_order --plot-order '$plot_order' #end if --png-width $png_width --png-height $png_height --output-image-file $output_image_file

param.name: reduction_use
param.label: Dimensionality reduction
param.help: Which dimensionality reduction to use. Default is "pca", can also be "tsne", or "ica", assuming these are precomputed

param.name: cells_use
param.label: Cells list
param.help: File to be used to derive a vector of cells to plot (default is all cells)

param.name: cols_use
param.label: Colors
param.help: Comma-separated list of colors, each color corresponds to an identity class. By default, ggplot assigns colors.

param.name: pt_shape
param.label: Cell attribute for shape
param.help: If NULL, all points are circles (default). You can specify any cell attribute (that can be pulled with FetchData) allowing for both different colors and different shapes on cells.

param.name: coord_fixed
param.label: Fixed-scaled coordinate system
param.help: Use a fixed scale coordinate system (for spatial coordinates). Default is FALSE.

param.name: no_axes
param.label: Remove Axes
param.help: Setting to TRUE will remove the axes.

param.name: dark_theme
param.label: Use a dark theme for the plot..

param.name: plot_order
param.label: Ident (clusters) order
param.help: Comma-separated string specifying the order of plotting for the idents (clusters). This can be useful for crowded plots if points of interest are being buried. Provide either a full list of valid idents or a subset to be plotted last (on top).

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
Seurat_ is a toolkit for quality control, analysis, and exploration of single cell RNA sequencing data. It is developed and maintained by the `Satija Lab`_ at NYGC. Seurat aims to enable users to identify and interpret sources of heterogeneity from single cell transcriptomic measurements, and to integrate diverse types of single cell data.
This tool graphs the output of a dimensional reduction technique (PCA by default). Cells are colored by their identity class.
-----
**Inputs**
* Seurat RDS object
-----
**Outputs**
* PNG-format image file
.. _Seurat: https://www.nature.com/articles/nbt.4096 .. _Satija Lab: https://satijalab.org/seurat/
